span.style: font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; orphans: 2; text-align: left;

span.span: At this time, in accordance with the guidelines of the Oklahoma State Board of Education's mandatory closure of Oklahoma schools, Carnegie Public Schools will be closed through Sunday, April 5th. During this time, NO groups can assemble on school grounds or in school facilities. All school buildings, athletic facilities, and fields will remain closed during the closure. All school related activities and events scheduled during the closure have been cancelled. Any plans for re

span.style: font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; orphans: 2; text-align: left; display: inline;

span.span: scheduling will be made once the closure has ended. During the two-week mandated closure, academics and grading has been suspended by the State Department of Education (SDE). We are awaiting information concerning Federal Waivers that the SDE has submitted to provide guidance on State Testing and other Federal requirements.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;
p.span: During the closure there will be phone contact availability with the school during the hours of 9 AM to 12 Noon (Monday-Thursday). Parents or families can make contact by calling the Superintendent's Office at

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 6px;
p.span: The district, as requested by the SDE will be making arrangements for a "Grab and Go" Sack Lunch Program for students beginning on Monday, March 23rd. School Administration will have sack lunches available for student pick up at 11:30 AM - 12 Noon at the South End of Main Street, the North End of the Memorial Building, and near Carnegie Lumber. Any child 18 years or younger will be eligible to come to one of these locations to pick up a FREE sack lunch.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 6px;
p.span: We will continue to share important information through our school page FB Page, so please watch here for updates. We encourage you to share this information with family and friends.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 6px;
p.span: We appreciate your patience and flexibility as we move forward.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 6px;
p.span:
Mr. Eric Smith, Superintendent
Mrs. Lori Walters, CES Principal
Mr. Randy Turney, CMS Principal
Mr. Matthew Fox, CHS Principal
Mr. Jim Harvey, Athletic Director
Mr. Billy Harmon, Maintenance Director

a.span: Toolkit & Video Now Available to Help Educators, Families Talk About Test Results

span.strong: “Do you know the early warning sign of children with special needs: Do you know a child who has special needs: Carnegie Public Schools meets the needs of these children through the Special Education Department. If you know of a child who may need help, contact Mr. Smith, Superintendent, at Carnegie Public Schools, or Connie Leitner, Special Education Director, at (580) 654-1470.”

span.span: Each year individuals steal federal education dollars or misuse them for their own personal use.
These vital funds provide educational opportunities that build the future of America.
Don’t let them get away with it!
Stop fraud, waste, and abuse of federal education dollars.
If you suspect waste, fraud or abuse, report it today.
Submit your complaint via the web at:
or via U.S. Postal mail at:
*Operators do not accept reports over the phone

span.strong: Do you know the early warning sign of children with special needs: Do you know a child who has special needs: Carnegie Public Schools meets the needs of these children through the Special Education Department. If you know of a child who may need help, contact Mr. Smith, Superintendent, At Carnegie Public Schools, or Connie Leitner, Special Education Director, at (580) 654-1470."
